summary: ICP starter app with Motoko backend canister and React/Vite/Tailwind frontend scaffold, including Internet Identity auth hooks, shadcn/ui component library integration, build/deploy template tooling, and a Valentine proposal page experience (Yes/No with evasive No button, confetti, and a cat-kissing meme shown on Yes saying ‚ÄúYay Ginjo will be so happy ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù).
architectural_notes: Project uses ICP canister architecture: Motoko backend + React/Vite frontend with generated Candid bindings for actor calls.
Authentication is handled via Internet Identity on the frontend, with a dedicated actor hook for authenticated backend interaction.
UI layer is based on Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui component primitives.
Repository includes a reusable build/deploy template (Docker + workspace tooling + scripts) for consistent packaging and deployment.
Frontend includes shared data/query helper modules (e.g., useQueries) and a StorageClient utility for consistent client-side persistence/data access.
Frontend linting includes custom ESLint rules to enforce project-specific constraints (e.g., no BigInt in query keys; require Internet Identity provider usage patterns).

generatedImages.description: Generated image asset placed in public assets for use by the frontend.

existing_features.title: Motoko backend canister scaffold
existing_features.description: Backend canister code and Candid interface scaffolded for ICP deployment (Motoko core + did bindings).

existing_features.title: React + Vite + Tailwind frontend scaffold
existing_features.description: Frontend application scaffold with Vite, React, Tailwind CSS, app entrypoints, and configuration.

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication integration (frontend hooks)
existing_features.description: Frontend hooks/utilities for connecting to Internet Identity and creating an authenticated actor for backend calls.

existing_features.title: shadcn/ui component library integrated
existing_features.description: A large set of shadcn/ui components added to the frontend for rapid UI development.

existing_features.title: Build template and deployment tooling
existing_features.description: Build template including Dockerfile, scripts (image resize/prune), workspace configs, and ICP deployment configuration files.

existing_features.title: Generated static asset included
existing_features.description: A generated image asset added to the frontend public assets directory.

existing_features.title: Frontend query utilities and data-access helpers
existing_features.description: Adds frontend data-access helpers including a shared query hook module (useQueries) and a StorageClient utility, along with custom ESLint rules to enforce safe query key usage (e.g., avoid BigInt in query keys) and require an Internet Identity provider where needed.

existing_features.title: Valentine proposal page UI/interaction flow
existing_features.description: Implements a simple romantic-themed page asking ‚ÄúAthira K M‚Äù to be my Valentine, with Yes (heart) and No (broken heart) options; No button evasively moves away on hover (up to 100 times); clicking Yes triggers confetti and displays the ‚ÄúGood choice ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù image asset.

existing_features.title: Update the post-acceptance (after clicking ‚ÄúYes ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù) experience to display the message: ‚ÄúYay Ginjo will be so happy ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù alongside the existing cute cats-kissing meme image.
Ensure the main proposal view asks exactly: ‚ÄúAthira K M, will you be my Valentine?‚Äù and shows the two options ‚ÄúYes ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù and ‚ÄúNo üíî‚Äù.

Preserve and verify the evasive behavior: hovering (or pointer interaction) over ‚ÄúNo üíî‚Äù moves it away, allowing up to 100 evasions so it is effectively not clickable until the evasion limit is reached.
Add a confetti transition effect that plays when the user clicks ‚ÄúYes ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù before (or as) the accepted view is revealed.
In the post-acceptance view, display an animated image (GIF) of two cats kissing and the message exactly: ‚ÄúYay Ginjo will be so happy ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù.
Ensure the Valentine page uses a romantic pink-and-white visual theme consistently across both the proposal view and the post-acceptance view.
Add the new animated cats-kissing GIF as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it directly from the frontend (do not serve it via the backend).

Add a subtle, delightful animation to the ‚ÄúYes ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù button on the main Valentine proposal view to make it feel more special when the user interacts with it (hover and/or click), without changing any existing text or the overall Valentine flow (confetti, accepted view, and evasive ‚ÄúNo üíî‚Äù behavior must remain unchanged).

new_feature_requests.summary: Update the Valentine page post-Yes experience to show a cute meme of 2 cats kissing with the text ‚ÄúYay Ginjo will be so happy ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù.

Provide a standalone romantic Valentine page implementation using plain HTML/CSS/JavaScript (pink/white theme), with Yes/No, evasive No on hover, confetti on Yes, and a 2-cats-kissing GIF plus the message ‚ÄúYay Ginjo will be so happy ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù.
Add a small animation to the ‚ÄúYes ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù button to make the interaction feel sweeter (e.g., subtle pulse/bounce/scale on hover/click).

projectName: Update Valentine surprise page to show the requested post-Yes message and meme
